text: Losing something is sad, and losing someone is painful — but nothing compares to losing yourself. As long as you haven’t lost who you are, you can rebuild and achieve much. But if you have, your first mission is to find your way back.
True strength is not born of ease, but forged in the fires of pain and loss — crafted from uncommon material.
We draw our greatest strength when we fight for what we believe in. If the battle drains you, perhaps it was never yours to begin with.
It doesn’t matter where you came from — what truly matters is where you're determined to go.
